results.title: Alice in Wonderland
results.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi, Hamilton Luske, Wilfred Jackson, Ben Sharpsteen, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Animated version of Lewis Carroll’s famous story about the delightful Alice who goes on a dream fantasy adventure where animals are like humans and everything is nonsense. Voices provided by Kathryn Beaumont, Ed Wynn, Richard Haydn and Stirling Holloway.

results.title: Puberty Blues
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Joan Long, Margaret Kelly and Limelight Productions
results.brief_description: A popular coming-of-age story set on Cronulla Beach, where two high school girls, Debbie and Sue, have to navigate the chauvinism and sexism of the popular Greenhills surf gang to find their own selves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Beresford, Joan Long, Margaret Kelly and Limelight Productions
results.description: Unusually, the focus here is on the sexual and social rites of passage of two teenage girls in a male-dominated world. Debbie and Sue are accepted into the Greenhills’ gang, an elite group occupying a particular stretch of Cronulla beach. As surfie groupies Debbie and Sue are required to submit to male whims. Although the girls are proposed as subjects the film maintains a humorously ironic distance from the awfulness of the scene, particularly through the use of narration. The boys, collectively dominant, are individually consigned to the margins. Debbie and Sue are the real mates who ultimately break out of the confines of male-imposed rules. Cast includes: Nell Schofield, Jad Capelja, Geoff Rhoe, Tony Hughes. Based on the book by Cathy Lette and Gabrielle Carey.
description_for_label: Unusually, the focus here is on the sexual and social rites of passage of two teenage girls in a male-dominated world. Debbie and Sue are accepted into the Greenhills’ gang, an elite group occupying a particular stretch of Cronulla beach. As surfie groupies Debbie and Sue are required to submit to male whims. Although the girls are proposed as subjects the film maintains a humorously ironic distance from the awfulness of the scene, particularly through the use of narration. The boys, collectively dominant, are individually consigned to the margins. Debbie and Sue are the real mates who ultimately break out of the confines of male-imposed rules. Cast includes: Nell Schofield, Jad Capelja, Geoff Rhoe, Tony Hughes. Based on the book by Cathy Lette and Gabrielle Carey.

results.title: The Best of Britain
results.creator_credit: Moviemaker Film and Television Production Co
results.brief_description: The Best of Britain takes you to nine of Britain’s most beautiful cities and towns. It is a detailed and colourful record of these historic places of interest, which represent a unique heritage and reflect the distinctive ambience which can only be described as the best of Britain. Rated: G

results.title: Married life (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Part One of the series “The Family of Man”’ which sets out to compare family life in five different locations around the world. In a comparison of marriages, with men and women sometimes having several partners, this program sets out to discover what, if anything, these marriages have in common. Husbands and wives, shown going about their daily lives are interviewed.

results.title: Home and away (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
The most important event in the life of most five year olds is starting school. With this comes a widening of relationships to include teachers and friends. It is not always an easy step and some children are disturbed by it.

results.title: All in the game (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
All the aspects of development so far considered in this series come together in play. The quality and type of play depend on all three. The way in which individual and group play develops, and the various forms this play takes are examined in this program. Narrated by Hugh David.

results.title: Child Self Esteem
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
In this title we commence by differentiating between self concept and self-esteem. We discuss how by the age of two, a child has a well developed self concept. The crucial role of parents in the development of a child’s self-esteem is discussed, and we show how an understanding of child development is helpful in fostering good self-esteem in a child. We use dramatisations to show how parental behaviours influence child self-esteem, and conclude by discussing with two parents changes they made in their approach to their children.
